alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:30PM CST until January 11 at 7:24PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Recent heavy rainfall occurred over the Catoma Creek basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Catoma Creek. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.Thursday morning at 830 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
